intro: Tritonia atrorubens, commonly known as the red-tipped tritonia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its striking red-tipped leaves and showy white to pink flowers. It prefers well-drained soil and partial to full shade for optimal growth.
